definition: to put one's heart (and soul) into sth/with great care

sentences.english: After taking good care of himself, he recovered from his illness.
sentences.chinese: 经过悉心调养，他的病已痊愈。

sentences.english: Jack utmost care and protection of Luke, to teach him to read.
sentences.chinese: 杰克悉心照顾和保护路克，教他读书。

sentences.english: With the nurse's careful attendance, the patient finally recovered.
sentences.chinese: 经过护士的悉心照料，那个病人终于恢复了健康。

sentences.english: He soaked himself in the subject before daring to write about it.
sentences.chinese: 他悉心研究这个题目之后才敢下笔写。

sentences.english: To wipe out Xixia , the Song government engaged in Xihelu carefully.
sentences.chinese: 宋政府悉心经营熙河路，目的是为灭亡西夏打基础。

sentences.english: So his two biggest fans are taken care of.
sentences.chinese: 因此他的两个最大的粉丝得到了悉心照料。

sentences.english: Our mind and bodies need to be taken care of.
sentences.chinese: 我们身心都需要悉心照料。

sentences.english: However, as a trumpeter father and son are taken care of, he has to wake up.
sentences.chinese: 不过经吹鼓手父子的悉心照料，他已经醒过来。

sentences.english: But our people grow them with their hearts to ensure this exhibition, " said 20-year-old Kim Pom.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们的人民为了这次展览悉心种植它们。

sentences.english: YouBin care day and night, she recognised.
sentences.chinese: 尤斌没日没夜悉心照顾，得到周母认可。

sentences.english: And then you care and feed it after it’s started to grow.
sentences.chinese: 在它开始成长后，你还要继续悉心照顾，补充营养。

sentences.english: February red body issues, have been at his side taken care of.
sentences.chinese: 二月红身体抱恙，莫测一直在他身边悉心照料着。

sentences.english: Mr Treatment with base surface to Dai Jinhua bee venom.
sentences.chinese: 金戈悉心用碱面给戴金花治疗蜂毒。

sentences.english: He owes it to his doctor's care that he's quite well again.
sentences.chinese: 多亏了他医生的悉心照料，他身体又好起来了。

sentences.english: Millennials want loads of attention and guidance from employers.
sentences.chinese: 新千年一代希望得到就职单位的重点关注和悉心指导。

sentences.english: She cared them with love and the birds grew strong.
sentences.chinese: 经他悉心照料，鸟儿一天天强壮起来。

definition: making an all-out effort (idiom); to try one's heart out/to do one's utmost
to tend/to take care of sb
to the utmost/in every possible way
to bless/to cherish/to take good care of/to conserve
painstaking effort/to take a lot of trouble/laborious at pains
to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
